Amazon App Notifier is a free and open source notification manager for providing notifications for the free app of the day on the Amazon Appstore.

Developer: Derek (Skylark95)
Contact: derek@skylark95.com
Website: http://www.skylark95.com/

Thanks to the following open source projects:
• ActionBarSherlock
• CommonsWare Android Components
• Jackson JSON Processor

Others can be found in app description on play store and on GitHub project page.

Please send feature requests or bug reports to derek@skylark95.com or submit them on GitHub project page

Changing Settings

Settings for this app can be access by pressing the change settings button on the settings tab as well as be accessed though the menu.

The settings are organized in 2 sections: Basic Settings and Advanced Settings. Basic Settings covers the essentials for the app, while Advanced Settings allows you to fine tune more specific options. Descriptions and current values for each setting can be found in the settings menu.

Notification Update Time

The Free App of the day on the Amazon App Store is updated around 12am PST (2am CST). The data populated in the notification is stored in a database on a shared server and is updated at this time.

If Amazon pulls the Free app of the day and replaces it with another app, the notification may inaccurately report what the free app of the day is (Although this doesn\'t happen too often).

Testing the notification

The notification can be tested with the settings you applied at any time by pressing the test notification button on the settings tab

Installing Amazon Appstore

If you do not have the Amazon Appstore installed on your device, pressing the test notification button on the settings tab will give you a notification that prompts you to download the Amazon Appstore. Pressing this notification will then take you to a page where you can download the Appstore to your device.

The download page will give instructions on how to install the app, but for reference, those instructions are:

1. Open Settings and navigate to the Unknown sources option (under Applications or Security depending on your device).

2. Tap the checkbox and then tap OK on the confirmation popup.

Depending on your device, you may need to locate where files are downloaded to and select the downloaded APK file to install the Appstore

Outside the US

Currently this app only provides information that is accurate for the US version of the Amazon Appstore. This is because I need to pull the information for the free app of the day from sources outside the Appstore and currently this option is only avalible in the US.

For more detail, press the UK Users button on the about tab
